speaker: Niles
text: Hello?  Yes, Buck?  It's Dr. Crane.  I'm calling to see if the cabin is ready for us.  You've got the case of Montrachet? Good, good.  And the Thanksgiving feast will be delivered promptly at three?  Good.  And the woodpile's been thoroughly inspected for spiders?  Excellent!  Thank you. [_He hangs up._] Well, we're ready to rough it in the great Northwest! [_He goes to get a sherry._]

speaker: Daphne
text: If you don't mind me asking, are you taking along anything to keep your nephew amused?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, his grandfather.  Oh, by the way, what time are Lilith and Frederick flying in tomorrow?

speaker: Martin
text: Her broom touches down at eleven.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, now, when you mist the plants, make sure that the water is not too cold.  I know I'm harping on and on about this, but I know you're not used to dealing with delicate flowers.

speaker: Roz
text: I've produced your show for three years, haven't I?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll leave you our number at Niles's cabin, in case anything goes wrong.  Oh, yes, and by the way, I frown on overnight guests.

speaker: Roz
text: Then you're not doing it right.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll leave you my number in San Francisco, too.

speaker: Roz
text: You're not going to the cabin with them?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Daphne's decided to spend a traditional Thanksgiving with her transvestite Uncle Jackie.

speaker: Daphne
text: Come on, Roz, I'll show you around the kitchen.

speaker: Roz
text: So, this uncle of yours, does he dress like a woman all the time?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, certainly not for work.  His congregation would never stand for it.

speaker: Martin
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, just a little depressed.  It's my first Thanksgiving without Maris.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, I know, son.  It's hard.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you remember the year I plopped that big wedge of pumpkin pie in front of her, and we all laughed? [_They all share a chuckle._] Then I put a big scoop of whipped cream on top of it and we laughed some more! [_Another chuckle._] Then her eyes welled up with tears and we all knew it was time to stop.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Yes, Lilith.  Yes, Lilith.  Yes, Lilith.

speaker: Martin
text: Gee, it's like they're still married. _CUT TO: the kitchen. Daphne has grabbed a bottle from the liquor shelf.  Roz has the glasses._

speaker: Daphne
text: If you change the paper towels, he likes the flap facing the front.  If you change the bathroom tissue, the flap faces the back, don't ask me why.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know how you live with him.

speaker: Daphne
text: Huh, I don't know how you work with him.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I have learned a trick: when he's really bugging me, I ask if he hasn't lost a little weight.  Before you know it, he's checking his butt out in the glass of the candy machine.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughing_]  Really?  I tell him he's gained weight.  He skips dinner, sulks in his room, and I have the whole evening to myself. _They laugh and clink glasses.  CUT TO: the living room._

speaker: Frasier
text: OK, you tell Frederick I said "Bravo!" [_He hangs up._] Frederick just passed the qualifying exam for the Marbury Academy!

speaker: Niles
text: Huzzah!

speaker: Martin
text: What is that?  Some school?

speaker: Frasier
text: "Some-school?"  Oh, Dad, please.  The Marbury Academy is the most exclusive private school in all of Boston.

speaker: Niles
text: It's a breeding ground of power and privilege.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith and I have to be interviewed by the headmaster. He's got such a busy schedule, he's agreed to see us on Thanksgiving morning.  Now this, of course, changes our plans.

speaker: Martin
text: Wait, you mean I don't get to see my grandson?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course you do.  We'll move our whole Thanksiving celebration to Boston.  I'll call the airline.

speaker: Niles
text: [_Pulling out his cell phone_]  Yes, I better cancel our rustic Thanksgiving. [_into phone_] Hello, Buck?  It's Dr. Crane.  Take the mints off the pillows. _FADE OUT  Scene 2 - Lilith's Kitchen Fade in.  Lilith is working on dinner._

speaker: Lilith
text: Frederick, your father is here. _Freddie runs to the door and goes out, shouting "Dad!"  The three men all greet him cheerily.  Martin and Niles come in with the bags. Niles has a bottle of wine._

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Lilith, how ya doin'?

speaker: Niles
text: Happy Thanksgiving, Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: Martin, Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: Nice neighborhood.  Noticed a whole bunch of kids Freddie's age playing in the street.

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, he's spent many happy hours at his window observing their play patterns.  Niles, I'm afraid with this interview, I'm running a little behind schedule.  So, I'm enlisting you to help with the turkey.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, I've never cooked a turkey before, but the recipe's here, I guess I can fumble my way through.  How far along are you?

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm nearly done defrosting.

speaker: Niles
text: [_unable to resist_] And the turkey?

speaker: Lilith
text: Might I suggest you stuff it?

speaker: Frasier
text: So the rabbit said to the bear, "No, no, I said 'oedipal,' not 'edible!'"

speaker: Freddie
text: Good one, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Lilith. [_kisses her cheek_]

speaker: Lilith
text: You're late.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, happy Thanksgiving to you, too.  Well, there Frederick. [_puts him down_] Now, Mommy and Daddy have to head off to this meeting, then I'm all yours.  Meanwhile, why don't you head off upstairs and show Grandad and Uncle Niles your brand-new computer.

speaker: Freddie
text: OK.

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, sport.

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, are you half as nervous as I am?

speaker: Lilith
text: And then some.

speaker: Frasier
text: We have got to master our nerves.  It is vital that we appear to be well-adjusted, responsible parents.  Lilith, do you still keep the Valium with the contraceptives?

speaker: Lilith
text: Sorry, I needed the last one just to go in and pick up the application.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll assume you meant the Valium.

speaker: Lilith
text: Perhaps before the interview, you should sheath that butter-knife sharp wit of yours.

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps we could find the appropriate kitchen tool to ratchet down that butt of yours a notch or two!

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, stop.  We should be focusing on our son.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right, of course.  We've always had our differences but we've been able to put them aside for the welfare of Frederick.

speaker: Lilith
text: And this may be the most important thing we ever do to ensure his happiness.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not counting our divorce.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Freddie and I are gonna break in this new mitt I bought him.  [_He musses Freddie's hair._]

speaker: Lilith
text: [_smoothing Freddie's hair_] Uh, Frederick doesn't play ball.  He was just about to watch "Pocahontas" and write a satirical essay on the historical inaccuracies.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we're off.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, wait, where do you keep your saffron?

speaker: Lilith
text: Third cupboard.

speaker: Niles
text: Mm-hmm, and where do you keep your shallots?

speaker: Lilith
text: In the crisper.  By the way, you still have to remove the entrails from the chest cavity.

speaker: Niles
text: In that case, where do you keep your ten-foot pole?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, now, Freddie.  Mommy and Daddy are going to see you're wearing a Marbury blazer or die trying.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, maybe you should remove the entrails.

speaker: Martin
text: No can do.  Freddie and me are gonna play catch.

speaker: Freddie
text: Mother says balls are for the slow children.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah?  Well, Grandpa's in charge now.  You're gonna love baseball, it's easy as riding a bike.

speaker: Freddie
text: Mother says bikes are for the...

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I know, I know. **STOP SAYING "DOCTOR"** _Scene 3 - Dr. Campbell's House. Fade in.  It is a very fancy sitting room.  The doorbell rings. Dr. Campbell opens the door to reveal Lilith and Frasier._

speaker: Lilith
text: Dr. Campbell.

speaker: Campbell
text: Dr. Sternin.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dr. Campbell.

speaker: Campbell
text: Dr. Crane.  Please come in.

speaker: Lilith
text: You have a lovely home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and thank you so much for seeing us today.

speaker: Campbell
text: You're quite welcome.  Make yourselves comfortable, I'll get us some coffee.

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: I think that went rather well, don't you?

speaker: Lilith
text: So far, so good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, we have just got to get Frederick into this school.

speaker: Lilith
text: I am so nervous, I feel as though all the color has drained from my face.  How is my makeup? [_They sit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you could use a pinch.

speaker: Lilith
text: Do I have time?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, you could use a pinch. [_He pinches her cheeks hard to put some color in them._]

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you. _Frasier plucks at something on the chair, a long thread comes out in his hand._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh lord.  Oh, dear.

speaker: Lilith
text: What?  What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I just reached down to pull a thread off what I thought was my jacket, it seems it attached to this cushion. Oh, look, now this little bird has no beak!

speaker: Lilith
text: Stop doing that!

speaker: Frasier
text: Give me your nail clippers.

speaker: Lilith
text: I didn't bring them, just bite it off. _Frasier does, getting down on his knees and biting the thread off close to the cushion.  Dr. Campbell comes back with the coffee as Frasier scrambles back to his seat._

speaker: Campbell
text: Does either of you take cream?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, thank you.

speaker: Campbell
text: [_sitting_] Then let me begin by saying that the child who fills this opening need not worry for the future.

speaker: Lilith
text: Opening?  There's only one?

speaker: Campbell
text: Yes.  Well, children of alumni and certain generous benefactors are of course given preference.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, of course.

speaker: Lilith
text: Of course.

speaker: Campbell
text: Now, regarding your Frederick.  His scores are of course excellent and I've no doubt he's being courted by other prestigious schools.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that goes without saying.

speaker: Campbell
text: Still, we like to think we are a cut above.  Our sixth grade talent show just formed a highly successful cast album.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frederick has perfect pitch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, we often use him to tune the piano.

speaker: Campbell
text: Excuse me. [_answers_] Hello?  Ah, Senator Geiger.  I thought I made it perfectly plain that you'd be notified by mail.  Well, Senator, rules may not mean anything on Capitol Hill, but they still mean something to me.  And that is why young Noah will be seeking his education elsewhere.  Do I SOUND flexible?  Marbury thanks you for your interest.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, your coffee.

speaker: Campbell
text: Oh, yes, please be careful.  Those chairs have been in the family for three generations. _FADE TO:  Scene 4 - Lilith's Kitchen Fade in.  Niles is cooking, Martin has an ice pack over Freddie's face._

speaker: Martin
text: OK, let's take a look. [_There is a huge bruise on one eye._] Oh, it's not so bad.

speaker: Niles
text: AHH! [_then:_] Ya hardly notice it. [_He takes a drink._]

speaker: Freddie
text: Uh-oh, I lost my MedicAlert bracelet.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, maybe it fell off when we were playin' catch.

speaker: Freddie
text: I'll go look.  [_He goes outside._]

speaker: Martin
text: All right.  I still don't know how it happened.  I lobbed it right to him.

speaker: Niles
text: When are you going to learn, Dad?  The only thing the Crane boys are skilled at catching is sarcastic nuance and the occasional virus. [_He opens the fridge looking for something._] Let's make a pact that while we are guests of Lilith's we'll avoid all activities that could possibly harm Frederick. Where are those pie crusts?

speaker: Freddie
text: [_coming in_] Found it. _Just as he gets fully into the kitchen, Niles quickly pulls open the freezer side door.  There is a thump, and when he closes it, Freddie is standing there holding his nose._

speaker: Freddie
text: I taste blood.

speaker: Martin
text: Now you've done it!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, God, Frederick, I am so sorry. _He gives Freddie his handkerchief and tells him to pinch his nose. There is the sound of a car pulling up._

speaker: Martin
text: It's them!  Hey, pal, why don't we go find some cotton upstairs for that thing, huh?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, wait, wait, how am I going to explain this to Lilith?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't know.  How did you give Maris bad news?

speaker: Niles
text: Usually by breaking a tranquilizer in her Slim Fast. _Martin and Freddie go off, Niles checks the fridge, then quickly steps to the stove as Frasier and Lilith enter._

speaker: Lilith
text: Did you notice how those patrician eyebrows of his arched when you mentioned Frederick's National Science Award?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: I take it Dr. Campbell was favorably impressed.

speaker: Lilith
text: We had an initial bout of nervousness, but after that, we did an absolute bang-up job.

speaker: Niles
text: Speaking of bang-up jobs...

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Lilith, there's just one question I wished we'd answered differently.

speaker: Lilith
text: Which one?

speaker: Frasier
text: Remember when he mentioned that Frederick was being courted by other schools?  I wonder if we shouldn't have made it clear that Marbury is far and away our first choice.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, if you over-analyze every detail, you will rob us of the joy of the moment.  It will be our wedding night all over again.

speaker: Niles
text: Speaking of hard-to-explain bruises...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, you're right, you're right, of course.  I'm sure everything's fine.

speaker: Lilith
text: Unless we didn't convey to him how highly we regard Marbury.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you see, that is my worry.

speaker: Lilith
text: We must correct this.  [_She picks up the phone._]  What should I say?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Lilith, stop, stop.  Remember what happened when the senator called.  We need a ruse.

speaker: Lilith
text: You're right.  How's this?  We go back and I say that I lost my earring in his living room.

speaker: Frasier
text: And while we're looking for it, we casually mention that Marbury is Frederick's first and only choice.

speaker: Lilith
text: Perfect.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's go.

speaker: Niles
text: Speaking of dumb-ass ideas... _He drinks.  FADE OUT  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Dr. Campbell's house. Fade in.  Frasier and Lilith are outside the door; they ring the bell and Dr. Campbell, in an apron, answers._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, yes, Dr. Campbell, I hope we're not disturbing anything important.

speaker: Campbell
text: Well, actually, I'm a bit frazzled trying to get my Thanksgiving dinner together.

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm afraid I lost an earring here this morning.

speaker: Campbell
text: Well, I'll have a look around and call you if it turns up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, um...

speaker: Lilith
text: Do you think I might be able to take a peek right now?  I wouldn't even think of asking, but it was a treasured gift from... Golda Meir.

speaker: Campbell
text: Very well. [_They come in._]

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you.

speaker: Campbell
text: Forgive me.  I must turn the heat down on the pumpkin soup. [_He exits to the kitchen._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith, we rehearsed everything we were going to say on the ride over.  Where the hell did Golda Meir come from?

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, I admit it wasn't half as clever as "Umm..." but it got us in.

speaker: Campbell
text: [_from kitchen_] Any luck?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not yet.

speaker: Lilith
text: We're so sorry for this.  The whole ride over, we kept saying "Why did this have to happen at the only school that matters to us?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, as you know, Marbury is our first choice.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, look, here it is.  That was lucky.

speaker: Campbell
text: Remarkably so, considering that wasn't the chair you were sitting in.

speaker: Lilith
text: Umm...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose it's time we be shoving off.

speaker: Campbell
text: I'm curious.  I've always been a great admirer of Mrs. Meir.  How did you meet?

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, well, it's a funny story.  Frasier you tell it much better than I do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, yes, yes.  Back in college days, Lilith spent a summer at a kibbutz.  And, uh, was dating her grandson, Oscar.

speaker: Campbell
text: That would be Oscar Meir?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well just imagine the ribbing he took.

speaker: Campbell
text: [_leading them to the door_]  Indeed.  Well it was so good seeing you both again.  Enjoy you're Thanksgiving. Marbury thanks you for your interest.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, wait a minute.  "Marbury thanks you for your interest."  We know what that means.

speaker: Campbell
text: Oh good, then you'll have no trouble interpreting this. _He slams the door in their faces.  FADE TO:  Scene 2 - Lilith's Kitchen Fade in.  Niles is cooking.  Freddie is in a chair, cotton up his nose as Martin snips at his hair with scissors._

speaker: Niles
text: You had to give him gum, didn't you?  And not just gum, bubblegum.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, maybe what threw him off is having to breathe through his mouth while he chewed it.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, Frederick, when I was a boy, nothing brought a smile to my face like when Mother would make a remoulade and let me lick the spoon.

speaker: Freddie
text: Thanks, Uncle Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: You're welcome.

speaker: Martin
text: You think maybe I should trim his bangs a little bit?

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe you should put the scissors down while he still has one good eye.

speaker: Freddie
text: Uh-oh.  Is there anchovies in this?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  Oh my God!  I've never seen hives break out that fast! [_A car pulls up._] They're back!

speaker: Martin
text: Freddie, you got any pills for this?

speaker: Freddie
text: I got pills for everything.

speaker: Lilith
text: Of all the name in the universe, you had to pick Oscar?

speaker: Frasier
text: You started us down that path of insanity.  Golda Meir. Golda My-ass!

speaker: Lilith
text: This sniping is pointless.  Getting into Marbury was a longshot anyway.  You heard the man.  Most of these openings go to children of alumni and generous benefactors.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.  Wait a minute.  Oh, my God we're such fools! Don't you see what the man was trying to tell us?  He was trying to give us the way to get Frederick accepted.

speaker: Lilith
text: Are you saying he was fishing for a donation?  So you think he was just trying to see if we were willing to pay our fair share.

speaker: Frasier
text: What else?

speaker: Freddie
text: Hi, Daddy.

speaker: Frasier
text: In a minute, Frederick.  My God, it was right there in front of us and we missed it, we didn't even see it.

speaker: Lilith
text: How could we be so blind?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we should get ourselves back down there and give the man what he wants.

speaker: Lilith
text: Right, we can't let anything stand in the way of our son's welfare.

speaker: Freddie
text: Mother...

speaker: Lilith
text: Mother has to run, munchkin.  Go play with Grandpa. _Freddie looks towards the living room with quite a bit of fear.  FADE TO:  Scene 3 - Dr. Campbell's House Fade in.  Campbell comes to the door and opens it._

speaker: Campbell
text: Ah, Dr. Sternin and Dr. Crane.  Forgive me if I don't give you a big hello hug, but as you can see, I'm wearing this greasy apron.  On top of which, I'm beginning to loathe the sight of both of you.

speaker: Lilith
text: All the more reason for us to be brief.

speaker: Campbell
text: Yes, I'm sure you'll be on your way, just as soon as you've found the cufflink given to you by Haile Selassie.

speaker: Lilith
text: No false pretense this time.  We know that with so many qualified applicants and only one position open, that your decision must be very difficult.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and so, in the spirit of the holidays, like Indians to your pilgrims' table, we bring this little bit of garnish, as it were, in the hopes that our relationship may flower. [_He gives Campbell an envelope._]

speaker: Campbell
text: I'll have you know that, in twenty-two years, I have never accepted a bribe.  I have to tell you, I find this utterly offensive. [_He looks at the amount of the check._] In every possible way.  And now, if you don't mind, I have guests on the way.  And a turkey so undercooked, a skilled veterinarian could still save him.

speaker: Frasier
text: But, Dr. Campbell...

speaker: Campbell
text: Unless the rest of that sentence is "I have a fully cooked turkey in the breast pocket of that blazer," I'm afraid our conversation is at an end. _He closes the door.  Lilith and Frasier look at each other and get the same calculating look, then rush off.  FADE TO:  Scene 4 - Lilith's Kitchen Fade in.  Niles drinking wine, comes in, opens the oven and bastes the turkey.  Behind him, Martin hurries in, gets the icepack out of the freezer and hurries back out.  Niles closes the oven, grabs the bottle of wine, and follows.  Frasier and Lilith rush into the kitchen.  Frasier puts on oven mitts, Lilith opens the oven, he grabs the turkey and leaves, Lilith following with some garnish.  The oven timer goes off.  Niles comes into the kitchen and opens the oven.  Finding the bird gone, he closes it, then checks the top oven to make sure.  Confused, he looks around to see where the turkey might have gone.  FADE TO:_ **BEWARE OF GEEKS BEARING GIFTS** _Scene 5 - Dr. Campbell's Dining Room Fade in.  Dr. Campbell is standing at the head of a table with a family of three on either side._

speaker: Campbell
text: This is indeed a very special holiday for us all.  Pamela, Cynthia, I'm particularly grateful that finally you've been able to set aside your differences and join us in this Thanksgiving... tortellini.

speaker: Pamela
text: Well, as angry as I was that you'd admitted Regan into Marbury instead of our Wesley, it's all worked out for the best.  Wesley is thriving at the Barkley School.

speaker: Campbell
text: I am delighted to hear it.  Oh, I have a dusty bottle of Chateau LeFite waiting in the cellar for an occasion like this.

speaker: Preston
text: Well, this is nice.

speaker: Elliot
text: Yes, it is. _The doorbell rings.  They all say, "I'll get it."  Cynthia does the honors._

speaker: Cynthia
text: Hello.

speaker: Lilith
text: Hello, is Dr. Campbell in?

speaker: Cynthia
text: Yes, he's just gone to the cellar to get a bottle of wine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, we don't mean to intrude, but we heard he was having trouble with his turkey and we thought we should drop this by.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Oh, how very generous of you.  Please come in.  Look everyone, these friends of Collin's have brought us a turkey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think "friends" is probably stretching it just a tad.

speaker: Lilith
text: You see, our son was a candidate for Marbury, and in our zeal to see him accepted we may have come on a bit strongly.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I'm sure you'll understand as parents yourselves, it's only natural to wish only the very best for your son.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Oh, absolutely.

speaker: Pamela
text: There are other good schools.  Barkley is excellent.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, thank you very much for trying to cheer us up, but I mean, if you're looking for filet mignon, you can hardly swallow ground chuck.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Now, now, Barkley is a very charming little school.

speaker: Pamela
text: "Little school"?

speaker: Cynthia
text: Now, don't be so sensitive.

speaker: Pamela
text: Damn your condescension.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Damn your jealousy.

speaker: Elliot
text: Don't you talk to my wife that way!

speaker: Preston
text: Oh, shut up, Elliot!

speaker: Campbell
text: Quiet!

speaker: Frasier
text: We brought a turkey.

speaker: Campbell
text: I don't know how this started, I can only be sure it started with the two of you.

speaker: Lilith
text: Actually...

speaker: Campbell
text: I will die a happy man if I never set eyes on either of you again. [_They look heartbroken._] Unfortunately, there is only one way I can think of to ensure that: your son Frederick is hereby admitted to the Marbury School.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_They are both ecstatic._] Oh!

speaker: Campbell
text: [_holds up a hand_] However! - he will immediately be expelled if either of you violates any of the following conditions: you will not bring him to school, you will not collect him; you will not attend any recitals, plays, sporting events, or school functions, up to and including "Frederick Crane Day," should we ever have one. [_He leads them to the door._] And when graduation comes, you will dispatch an appropriate envoy with a video camera.  And now it is with great pleasure that I bid you goodbye - forever!

speaker: Frasier
text: Allow me. _He slams the door on himself and Lilith.  Cut to the porch as Lilith and Frasier look at each other smugly._

speaker: Both
text: We're in! _FADE OUT  End of Act 2_
